conclusion: Analyze the path and potential interactions with blocks to determine collisions and stopping point.
Car is positioned on the right side of the image moving towards the left; blocks are scattered on a green surface.
Car will first encounter the blue block near the center of the image.
Collision with the blue block will deflect the car; deflection depends on angle and speed.
After first collision, car may collide with other blocks depending on path and angles.
Deflection will change car's direction; it will continue until it stops or collides again.
Car stops when momentum is insufficient to overcome forces from blocks, likely after multiple collisions.
Car most likely collides with blue block first, then deflected to potentially collide with other blocks.
Exact final position depends on collision sequence and angles.
Car will collide with blue block and stop near it after a series of collisions.
